column4: Since the files aren't technically overwritten, you can use various tools to analyze the hard drive and get the files back

Sorry if this was already asked, but do you have backups?
You might want to purchase an external USB drive in the future, about double your hard drive space should be fine. I learned that the hard way

What I typically do is I backup my most important files to Dropbox, a USB stick, and an external hard drive, then I'll back up the slightly less important stuff to the USB drive, then just about everything to the external one
